revised_title: Comparing the Variations of Diurnal Magnetic Declination at Kew and Trevandrum Observatories
tldr: This paper compares the variations of diurnal magnetic declination recorded at Kew and Trevandrum observatories. The authors find that the turning points in the Kew declination-range curve generally occur before those in the Trevandrum curve. The oscillations of the Trevandrum curve are generally larger than those of the Kew curve, and they often follow rather than precede the corresponding oscillations in the Kew curve.
